required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of a Monoclonal Antibody KHK4083 in Moderate Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Multiple Ascending Dose Study (Induction Therapy) & Long-term Extension Therapy of an Anti-OX40 Monoclonal Antibody (KHK4083) in Subjects With Moderately Active UC

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safety and tolerability of administration of multiple ascending doses of KHK4083 and to select the highest dose tolerated by subjects with moderately active Ulcerative Colitis (UC) followed by a Long-term Extension Therapy (LTE) phase for eligible subjects with a clinical response.

detailed_description.textblock:
A Phase 2, double-blind clinical study of multiple ascending doses of KHK4083 (or placebo) with an Long-term Extension Therapy (LTE) phase will be conducted in approximately 60 randomized adult subjects with moderately active UC who have a documented unsuccessful previous treatment.
The Treatment Period includes double-blind Induction Therapy (12 weeks) and Open-label Therapy (OLE) phase phase (40 weeks) for eligible subjects at Week 12. Subjects already enrolled in the double-blind, long-term extension (LTE) under preceding versions of the protocol who worsen may be eligible to transition to the OLE up to Week 28.
The Follow Up Period after the last administration will be for up to 16 weeks.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with treatment-related adverse events
primary_outcome.description: To determine the safety and tolerability of KHK4083

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with treatment-related serious adverse events
primary_outcome.description: To determine the safety and tolerability of KHK4083

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who show improvement in the mucosa at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the modified Mayo endoscopy sub-score (mMES)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who show improvement in the mucosa at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the modified Mayo endoscopy sub-score (mMES)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with confirmed anti-KHK4083 antibodies (immunogenicity)
Proportion of subjects who achieve mucosal healing at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Mucosal healing is defined as modified Mayo endoscopy sub-score (mMES) of 0 or 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve mucosal healing at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Mucosal healing is defined as modified Mayo endoscopy sub-score (mMES) of 0 or 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve clinical improvement at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement will be based on a reduction in the total Mayo Clinic score (0 to 12).

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve clinical improvement at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement will be based on a reduction in the total Mayo Clinic score (0 to 12).

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve a clinical response at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Reduction in the total Mayo Clinic score of at least 3 points

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve a clinical response at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Reduction in the total Mayo Clinic score of at least 3 points

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve clinical remission at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission is defined as a total Mayo Clinic score of ≤ 2 and no subscores > 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve clinical remission at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission is defined as a total Mayo Clinic score of ≤ 2 and no subscores > 1

arm_group.description: Subjects who qualify will receive IV infusion treatments of KHK4083 from Baseline to Week 48.
Subjects will receive placebo IV infusion treatments from Baseline to Week 48.
